task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 314°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full facade/roofline of the main building ahead to estimate its height, so I should tilt up to capture the top portion without changing heading.
The view is now pointed due north and upward, so I should rotate back to the target building direction (~314°) while keeping the upward pitch to see its top for height estimation.
To estimate height I need to see the roofline relative to the base, so I should look up at the same heading to capture the full elevation of the building ahead.
The heading has again reset to north, so I must yaw left to ~315° while maintaining the up tilt to keep the building’s upper stories/roof in view.
I’ve returned to the target heading but still need a stable view including the roofline to estimate total height, so I should tilt up once more.
Since the view is again due north, I should rotate left to re-acquire the NW-facing building while keeping the upward pitch for height estimation.
I should stop rotating and instead provide a height estimate from the visible number of stories and typical floor-to-floor height since repeated tilt is not persisting.
